channel.title: Physic wave motion standig wave
channel.description:
k= 1/2L √(T/μ)
what does the k represents in this equation
thanks in advance :)

item.title: Physic wave motion standig wave
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You were saying that k is a constant that was equal to a formula. That’s like saying pi = 2,14159265+l, which is only true when l=1.

Read full topic

item.title: Physic wave motion standig wave
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:13, topic:314552”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=411029.msg3032779#msg3032779 date=1258503831]

seto didn’t give this in any context so for all we know it could be showing that k= 1/2L √(T/μ) where k is a constant that is also equal to some other equation

so it’s a constant that varies?
[/quote]

You never knew you could calculate constants using variables? :P[/quote]
k = f / a
no ofc it cant be calculated

just fuck off guys i was only trying to help, i didn’t see you offering any support.

Read full topic

item.title: Physic wave motion standig wave
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Synt[a”]x link=topic=411029.msg3032165#msg3032165 date=1258466213]
best reason i can think of why its not f is because f is also a naming used for force[/quote]F is used for force, not f.

[quote=“akl, post:6, topic:314552”][quote author=inertia link=topic=411029.msg3032138#msg3032138 date=1258462728]

how the fuck would it be a constant

I was wondering why they would give the letter k for frequency rather than f, y’know being as it’s the standard symbol and everything…
[/quote]
even if it was a constant why the fuck would it be k=…
?
would be something like f=ka[/quote]
It doesn’t have to be. seto didn’t give this in any context so for all we know it could be showing that k= 1/2L √(T/μ) where k is a constant that is also equal to some other equation. Obviously it’s not anyway, and he’s found out what it is so it doesn’t matter.

Read full topic
